description.narrative: Esm3ni ampliﬁes youth voice and agency, strengthens community media, builds critical thinking skills while producing and disseminating positive alternative narratives and youth-led media content. In a whole-of-community approach, the project engages community leaders, building the capacity of educators, local government institutions, and civil society to engage and to act as positive mentors to youth-led media projects. By building students’ media production skills and providing them with practical media experience, the program increases youth job-readiness and opens new employment opportunities. Esm3ni is funded by the ministry of foriegn affairs of the Netherlands. IREX will implement the program in partnership with a public university and a national NGO.

recipient-country.narrative: Esma'ni program is targeting young jordanians aged between 18-24. Mainly residing in Irbid city. But will also target young people from middle region such as Amman, Zarqa, Salt and Sabahb

sector.narrative: ESM3NI also aims at building capacities of Youth to be more conscientious consumers of information and creators of vibrant information

ESM3NI builds the capacities of a state university (Yarmouk university), by provisioning of highly needed equipment and building capacities of young volunteers (aged between 18-24). In addition, this quarter Esma'ni established a partnership with Jordanian civil society organization the Jordan Hashemite Fund for Human Development (JOHUD).
ESM3NI's overall objective is : Jordanian youth are more empowered & resilient to propaganda

description.narrative: Drawing on lessons learnt from the three cycles of training, the Esma’ni team and curriculum development experts finalized the Esma’ni curricula. The curricula was designed and translated for Esma’ni to leave behind a high standard comprehensive curricula that makes it easier for programme partners to replicate the Esma’ni model in the future.

title.narrative: Finalization and design of the curricula

description.narrative: Development of a comprehensive curricula that builds the capacities of young people aged between 18-24, to become more resilient to violent extremism.

During this quarter Esma’ni issued a subgrant to the education initiative Madrasati, to deliver part of the Esma’ni curriculum in 10 public schools. Madrasati is an initiative launched by Queen Rania Al Abdullah to tackle both the educational and physical situation of the neediest public schools in Jordan. IREX this quarter partnered with Madrasati on the Esma’ni programme to implement a Media Literacy Club for six consecutive weeks in ten public schools across five governorates; Amman, Zarqa, Irbid, Mafrak and Ajloun.

title.narrative: Training of Trainers (TOT) for 20 public school teachers

description.narrative: The Training of Trainers was completed in this quarter for 20 school teachers from 10 public schools across five governorates in Jordan. The training for 200 children aged between 14 and 16 years old, will occur over six weeks in the coming quarter.

title.narrative: Youth led radio programs produced and broadcast

description.narrative: The second and third cohorts of Esma’ni participants used the skills learnt during the radio production training to produce their programs, with the help and supervision of members of the Community Leaders Committee, which includes representatives of key local government and civil society institutions and was established earlier on in the program to mentor participants through the design and production of the radio shows. This quarter 10 programs were produced, each consisting of 6 episodes. The programs were broadcast on two radio stations; Farah Al Nas and Yarmouk FM.

comment.narrative: The target number of radio shows were 8, consisting of 6 episodes each. The actual number of radio shows produced and broadcast were 16, consisting of 6 episodes each.

title.narrative: Esma'ni radio programs evaluation and comparison with the baseline

description.narrative: To be able to evaluate the quality of the Esma’ni radio programs, the Yarmouk FM Listeners club assessed the six programs produced by the second cohort of participants and broadcast on Yarmouk FM. These results were compared to the baseline, previously established in the fourth quarter, and to the results of the first cohort. The Listeners Club used IREX’s Media Content Analysis Tool (MCAT) to evaluate the programs.

title.narrative: Measuring the quality of Esma’ni radio programs and improvements in quality of Yarmouk FM programming.
